alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Morton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Hamilton, Morton and Stanton Counties through 615 PM CDT/515 PM MDT/... At 545 PM CDT/445 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles north of Hartman to 13 miles north of Keyes. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elkhart, Syracuse, Johnson City, Rolla, Manter, Coolidge, Richfield, Wilburton, The Saunders Elevator and Big Bow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for southwestern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT/1000 PM MDT/ for southwestern Kansas.
